email_subject: Why the RIAA owes us all an apology
email_body: _____________________DAVID COURSEY_____________________ WHY THE RIAA OWES US ALL AN APOLOGY When recording industry types last week tried to get provisions against music swappers included in anti-terrorism legislation, they trivialized everyone involved in America's fight against terrorism--and proved themselves to be absolutely the sort of people who'd do anything for a buck. # _____________________NEWS ANALYSIS_____________________ Patrick Houston WHAT'S MS' ULTIMATE GOAL FOR XP? HINT: WAY MORE THAN AN OS When you first try out Windows XP, you're reminded no less than five--count 'em, five--times to sign up for its Passport authentication service. These pleas speak of far more than Microsoft's persistence. Like what? Like how it plans to become another AOL inside an OS. PLUS: APPLE HINTS AT 'BREAKTHROUGH' DEVICE. WHAT COULD IT BE?
